posts.com:
Welcome to /x/ - Paranormal. This is not a board for the faint of heart. If you need something to get started with, see the below lists for some basic resources. We hope you enjoy your venture into the spooks, the creeps and the unknown.

The resources in this thread are not exhaustive and are merely meant for beginners to get their footing.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Welcome to the Nobody General
Happy Rabbit Year Edition

>Who is the Nobody?
The Nobody is a figure alive today who has extraordinary spiritual powers, including the ability to influence reality with his conscious and unconscious mind, and intuitively receive guidance from the forces of Heaven.
He works to elevate people to their true potential, opposing those who seek power over others. He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will.

He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. If this place is to be more than a squandered opportunity, an overgrown garden, it requires voices such as yours, but many more. This is a place for spiritual discussions and help, not drama, attention seeking, or social content; there are other boards for that.

Focus on increasing your service to all and be more loving to yourself and everyone in order to raise your vibrational and consciousness level, and learn to forgive yourself and others. This will change the vibration of the planet and raise our shared consciousness, making us a better humankind one person at a time.
None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest.

>>33735374
>Lie down on bed/floor/something flat, bed's probably best
>Turn off the lights, close the curtains, personally I use a sleep mask but that's me, the point here is to have less distraction on your eyes.
>Lie as perfectly still as you can for 10-15 minutes, this is the same amount of time your body takes to start entering sleep cycles at night
>Keep your mind as clear as you can, personally I just focus on my breathing, picturing it in my head, focusing my mind on creating an image of a nose breathing focuses my mind and stops it wandering
>Wandering isn't preventing you from entering SATS, just makes it take longer
>Eventually your limbs will start feeling a bit heavier, your body is getting ready to sleep and you may start getting those random twitches your brain sends out which is just your brain checking if you're actually falling asleep or just pulling a prank on it,
>The odd twitch is fine just ignore it
>After 5 or so minutes from when your limbs started getting heavy you are more than likely in SATS, there's nothing too special about the state, don't expect anything mystical or wonderous, that's for Astral Projecting.
>From here quite literally just imagine what it is you want
>For example, you want to try the ladder experiment, just imagine yourself half way up a step ladder in first person pov, don't make it super important, just imagine it like you're recalling a memory, like today I walked to the fridge and pulled out some cheese

It's all about convincing your subconscious that what you're imagining, actually happened.
So if you go into it wanting to meet a specific girl "she has black, no blond hair. it's shor- ah wait I prefer long..." this shit gets you no girl. Plan out in advance what you're imagining.

A few more questions:

- Is there a guiding hand that can help steer you into good paths? Sometimes I feel like something bad happens outside of my control, but then I realize later it was for the best (this has happened numerous times in different contexts & severity). If I force happenings through manifestations, do I run the risk of scorning this guiding hand?

- Do you ever worry your manifestations aren't the right thing and will produce bad outcomes, or is the whole idea that there are no bad outcomes because you can always manifest positive changes? Like, you may summon a monster, but you can just as easily summon a sword to slay it?

- It feels like a major underlying belief here is that YOU/WE/I are our own gods. If that's true, then it feels like we can create our own morals. Are there any universal ethics we should adhere to? If someone manifests great powers and begins harming others, isn't he "allowed" to? It's his world, no? Or is it more accurate to say we are as powerful as gods, but are not gods, and must adhere to certain godly guidelines? Is this my world where I can do whatever the fuck I want, or is this a sandbox where I can play & have fun but shouldn't throw sand in other people's eyes less I get kicked out? (not that I personally have intentions of harming anyone, I actually feel a lot of love for my fellow humans recently, but I'm just wondering out loud here about the guides)

- Where's the line between this & hedonism? Or is hedonism as a concept something that we need to change & understand differently?

- This seems like an insanely powerful skill, one that could topple dynasties. Why would the powers that be allow these threads on such a public site if they contained the secret keys to becoming unstoppable? Part of me feels like anything real would be hidden in an instant.

Again, thank you. I am trying to gather as much info about this as possible, because so much of it is vibing with me & it's wonderful to explore.

Also, Reigen is the best and you will agree by the end of the show.

posts.name: The Ape of

>>33733308
>>33733272
Mahazel comes, at least in the West, from Agrippa, book two of the Three Books of Occult Philosophy. There, his is listed among four other infernal spirits:
>"Four Princes of divels, offensive in the Elements."
But this does not tell us where he comes from.
In Abramelin you can see that the name MHZL is alleged to have been handed down, "from the Rabbins" (Rabbis). And occupies the same place: Elemental Prince of Earth in the Northern station.

But where does he COME FROM?
So if we look at the Mandaean scriptures, we se an Archangel, mighty and powerful. His name is Mahziel and he is the Archangel of Logos itself. He is the "Highest First Word" who is the temporal incarnation of the capacity for speech to sculpt reality. At least three other of the Mothers and Fathers of Wytchblood have roots in Mandaean lore. They can inform you of what's going on. Because in Sabbatic craft, it's like Jazz, what's NOT being said is just as important as what IS being said.

This is just the tip of the iceberg, too.
You need to be able to discern this stuff. Being able to critically analyze this text (DBoE) is mandatory for success.

"I forwarded the above quote from ‘An Interview with Andrew D. Chumbley’ to John Power on June 06/21 and asked him to comment on it, with a view to his being quoted in this blog-post. Here is his reply in full from June 07/21:

“The idea at one time was that he would be next in line as preceptor, as he did have obvious talents. However I never gave him full initiation or the cult mantra, so it was more of a ‘probationer’ initiation, so that I could see how he shaped up. Eventually he cut ties with me with a ‘Kill the Guru’ ritual [so hence the tradition] then started a pseudo tantrik micro group with Mike Staley of Kenneth Grant’s Typhonian OTO, but soon fell out with him too after the usual ego-maniac attempt to take over. In all of this the only tantrik connection was bookish. He never did any work in the Uttara kaula tradition. Exaggerations and disinformation like this have since been quoted elsewhere and compounded errors. Even the quote you’ve sent says that Ranchi is in Uttara Pradesh State, which it is not, but it is in Bihar State, a couple States further south. He had never been out of England, let alone to India, yet is in your quote claiming to be head of a lineage of one of the 5 great Tantrik traditions, when he doesn’t even know where the guru lived who first passed the tradition to a westerner who passed the westernised form to me. The tradition continues in India with a native Indian and any use of the term Paramapraya [guru to the lineage] is again delusional self importance from Chumbley."

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I did everything I could despite terrible odds against me.

I took every chance, every longshot, and always tried to get the best out of life even if it was risky.

I did tons of drugs, fucked every willing woman I wanted to fuck, and tried my hand at everything that interested me even if it was very difficult. I played a sport, played music, played games, read, wrote, danced, and traveled the country.

I played the sage and the fool.

I said what was in my heart even if it meant losing friends. I was recklessly brave.

I was uncompromising. I did what I wanted to do despite consequences. I didn't give up on trying to be the best I could be. I rarely tried the safe easy option when there was a high risk high reward option.

I wasted time, but sometimes I just couldn't do any better. I found treasure im unexpected places.

I lived life on my terms despite suffering a lot and failing a lot. I have had incomprehensibly fucked up things happen to me and around me, and I'm coping with that and still recovering.

I have a lot of work to do to become physically and mentally fit after a years of severe mental illness. My goals require that fitness, and they will still be challenging to achieve.

I'm not old yet but I'm not young any more. I'm better now than I used to be despite the scars.

I am so amazingly lucky.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33715218
I'm pretty sure I died once. I was working construction briefly in my early 20's, and one day I was on some scaffolding. Anyway, some of the scaffolding was uneven and I tripped, falling off the side, approximately 30 feet towards a pile of breeze blocks collected in a pile on the ground below. The last thing I remember is putting my hands out and shutting my eyes closed just before I made impact with the ground. I kept my eyes closed, but this impact never came, so I opened my eyes and I was laying back down on the top level of the scaffolding again. Some of my work colleagues came over and asked me what happened, and I could only say I'm not sure. They later said I just tripped and fell, but just straight down, rather than over the edge as I remember. But this DID happen. I remember in that split second of falling, knowing I was about to smash into those breeze blocks face first and die. I remember the terror, the fear. I still had that fear even when I woke up and was OK. It actually affected me so greatly that I immediately quit construction as a career.

And yeah, I went over two sentences. Sue me.

Think of things that you actually remember really well. Strong emotional memories. A scary dog. The first kiss. A present that stuck in your memory. Your first rejection.

You remember who you are, your name, your left and right, you remember what house you're in when you wake up. Don't look where there's nothing to look at. If there was nothing that interested you in your breakfast why would remember it?

The second thing is structure to your memories. You can use method of loci, memory palaces. It is rather simple in principle, google it (libgen + "memory palace"). Once you apply it in practice you'll get it. If you remember the layout of your house then you already have your first palace.

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:

SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Well /LDG/, after about three months of journaling I've finally had a Lucid Dream. I was honestly ecstatic after so I wrote it down immediately .

At first I was in a city consumed by a disaster. I knew somehow that the disaster was some kind of flood, but the city itself looked like a run down version of 1920s New York, with a distinct absence of cars and any road meant for cars.

I was with a strange group and went into an apartment that I understood to be ancient. The inside of the building looked as if it hadn't been lived in for a while. Within my group there was apparently a girl that was a bug-human chimera of a sort, the creature seemed like it knew the place, and went to cook while the rest of the group which I recognised as friends from the past and current stage of my life sat around a large dinner table. Shortly, the bug-girl came with our food which she said was bug hearts. Nobody seemed to have a problem with this as we were in a crisis, but it seemed weird that nobody on the table at least complained.

This made me realise I was in a dream, the revelation of which took me into a completely green grass field that I understood would wake me up if I lingered around longer, in which I focused on the dream and found myself back on the table.

After gaining the freedom of knowing I'm in a dream looked at the building next to us and teleported there. The inside was like pic related but instead of the plastic and glossy everything seemed like it was made with a high quality and matte fabric, and in the shape of an office made from pillows.

Here, after hanging around and messing with things, I met and had sex with my gf and another thing that seemed to have a the form of a woman. The sex felt completely lifelike but I was lost in the pleasure and got transported to another dream which I didn't remember I was dreaming.

I won't write that second dream completely but I was in a battlefield in a forested mountainside by a sea or body of water.

had one last night. i was in my parents kitchen looking out into the backyard when i saw a huge bloody gorilla walking slowly towards the patio door. i thought i was hallucinating so i ask my dad if he could see it too and he said he could. there was also a second one coming right behind the first one so we started panicking because we didn't know what the fuck to do. we decided the safest thing to do was to go into the garage to try and hide and call the police.

now this part is going to sound racist but here go.. so we could here the two giant bloody gorillas enter the house through the patio door and then start rummaging through stuff like there were looking for something. it sounded an awful lot like 2 human rummaging through stuff looking for shit to steal. we peak in through the garage door and sure enough it was all just a ploy by two thieves to scare us into hiding so they could steal shit. they were wearing bloody gorilla costumes and when they entered the house they took their masks off to steal.

at this point i knew i was lucid because this was all so fucking ridiculous. i left my house and did a street level fly around my neighborhood for a bit which was fun as fuck. i came across a very busy market. the market had different areas that were for different countries from around the world, sort of like epcot. i went and tried some Danish pizza, it wasn't that great. the market itself had literally thousand of people wandering around though. by far the most amount of dream characters i have ever had in a lucid dream.

>In her Alexiad, Anna Komnene provides a description of an incendiary weapon, which was used by the Byzantine garrison of Dyrrhachium in 1108 against the Normans. It is often regarded as an at least partial "recipe" for Greek fire:
>This fire is made by the following arts: From the pine and certain such evergreen trees, inflammable resin is collected. This is rubbed with sulfur and put into tubes of reed, and is blown by men using it with violent and continuous breath. Then in this manner it meets the fire on the tip and catches light and falls like a fiery whirlwind on the faces of the enemies.
>There is also a surviving 9th century Latin text, preserved at Wolfenbüttel in Germany, which mentions the ingredients of what appears to be Greek fire and the operation of the siphōns used to project it. Although the text contains some inaccuracies, it clearly identifies the main component as naphtha. Resins were probably added as a thickener (the Praecepta Militaria refer to the substance as πῦρ κολλητικόν, "sticky fire"), and to increase the duration and intensity of the flame.
>A 12th century treatise prepared by Mardi bin Ali al-Tarsusi for Saladin records an Arab version of Greek fire, called naft, which also had a petroleum base, with sulfur and various resins added.

tl;dr Crude oil, pine resin and sulfur in some combination. Basically napalm.

Google makes it surprisingly easy to access declassified databases considering it's hosted across so many inaccessible portals. You just need to know what exact phrases/names to search.

The problem you're going to see is that the technologies used to interpret this phenomena are not well defined. At the end of the day, research continues because people don't know what they're looking at. That's why so much money has been spent on this study.

The maharishi effect is *absolutely* a hard, measurable expression of the consciousness field. It's basically EM; it follows the inverse square law of falloff. We need to study this.

Why is resonance and density so important in ancient ceremonial sites? Is it possible to shape consciousness using sound, music perhaps? Well of course it is, that's what this is all about. We need to start reconstructing ancient structures and putting them through tests using trained psychics. The ancients tried to record this data in structures for us and we need to recognize this.

I personally think the medical applications are the most important for validation. RV is easily proven, but the results are always the target of attacks on the experimentation methodology. These attacks are sustained by the nature of RV itself; it can be leveraged as an offensive tool so many people will resist its acknowledgment because they have security concerns.
Worst case scenario, RV is proven to the public and then classified as dangerous due to its potential misuse. The fact research is public exposes the study to this kind of scrutiny.

However, if we proved in a legitimate clinical trial that therapy reverses degenerative disease then you could have a public awareness explosion without any of the top-down management concerns. Nobody is going to stifle healing technology. It also helps that therapy like Reiki is already broadly accepted.

Speaking of reiki, there are also a lot of starting points for medical research in the historical record using these techniques. Not just practices/traditions but also healing structures. The typifying Naos of a temple has long been described as a place where healing energy is focused. You also have acoustic medical instruments and procedures represented in Egypt and Hindu cultures.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33734574
Medicine is pretty different from most other fields in that as long as you loosely observe the Maxim (least possible harm with maximum benefit) you can do pretty unusual things as long as the patient consents. This allows you to form a hypothesis, perform a study and publish those conclusive findings without interference.

In other fields, you'd publish your findings with the assumption others will replicate your study. Depending on the resources available, this process can be used to sequester certain topics. You have lots of examples of this in fuel and energy technology.

Medicine doesn't operate with the same attitude towards experimentation-- experiments do not often yield conclusive results in the context of their study so when they do, it's taken more seriously. Humans cannot be 'controls' since every body is so different, thus arguments about test conditions tend to be secondary criticisms.

Consider; you are designing a reentry capsule. The object must survive the forces of reentry. The capsule represents the psychoenergetics problem. You must get the problem down to earth without breaking it apart into a thousand pieces.
Imagine psychic research is thermodynamics. Spirituality is the aerodynamics.

The problem we have today is to design a psychoenergetics approach without overlapping spiritual science (which we simply don't understand as well.) Does this mean we have to exclude spirituality? No. It just means our solution cannot directly define things about spirituality we don't know. So to create our vehicle we setup a hypersonic wind tunnel and start testing various shapes. This is absolutely changing its aerodynamics, but all we're measuring is thermal energy. Aerodynamics doesn't matter because we can still understand aerodynamics through thermodynamics in this situation.

Pyschoenergetics is the same. It certainly involves spiritual mysticism, but to get the concepts to the ground we need to look at the things we can measure first even if we miss the whole picture. Once that's done the spiritual side may even become easier to understand.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33728954
>You have no understanding of mathematics and statistics.
No man, you don't. Based on what data we have, NASA estimates there could be 100 billion planets in our galaxy alone. Obviously many of these won't have moons or will only have moons that are the wrong size, but with 100,000,000,000 other chances to play with, the odds are already not as bad as you'd think. It is further estimated that the observable universe has 100,000,000,000 galaxies, each of which should have billions of other chances at least (if they're small) or even trillions (if they're noticeably larger). This doesn't even account for the universe we can't see yet but that very much does exist.
The odds get even better when you factor in that the moon's orbit is not static. A few hundred million years ago, the moon *did* completely obscure the sun. A few hundred million years from now, the moon will not be large enough to completely obscure the full disc. Many other orbits (if not all) will be similarly dynamic, so even worlds that aren't getting eclipses *this year* might have had them in the distant past or may be due to receive them in the far future.
Our current skies may be one in a hundred trillion, but we have *hundreds* of trillions to play with.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Posting the gender of the people involved can help you get your query answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.
•Be polite.

Not seen, heard.
I've seen unidentifiable light in the sky in Europe, I haven't seen such here yet. However as I said, I've heard something very weird.
One night at 2 AM or so, I was stirred awake by metallic humming and then a weird metallic sounding snorting sound. Imagine if you had a warthog power sniffing and snorting just outside thebwalls of your room. I live in an apartment not too high above the street and it felt like the source of the sound is moving around one of the walls to my balcony. It stayed there for a bit before moving away and stopping completely.
I have never heard anything like that in my life. It felt like it was an animal investigating my apartment from the outside but somehow also levitating or flying as I could have sworn the source of the noise was right on the other side of my wall.
I was way too scared (not afraid to admit it) to dare raise my blinds and take a look. I was afraid it could ram itself through my glass door and drag me away or something. I don't recall any extra light filtering through the blinds though, but I did notice a slight dip every now and then probably it obscuring the streetlamps as it moved.

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

>feminine sexuality and other weird stuff
For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

The fundamental difference between the living and AI is that the AI is a very low, perhaps the lowest possible, level of consciousness, whereas the human spirit is of a much higher level of consciousness.

One can see it as the difference between a hypnotized person who is completely programmable and unquestionably obedient, and another who is fully awake, alert, and lucid and one who will question every command you give them.

The ultimate nature of all things, including this physical universe, is mental.

As a human, you can visualize an object in your mind and see it in your mind's eye where no one else can see it. When you dream, everything around you seems very real, very vivid and solid to such a degree that you can forget that you are actually dreaming. But because this is your own dream, if you learn how to lucid dream, you will gain control over elements of your dream. And depending on how good you are, you can control virtually every single aspect of your dream and manipulate it as you see fit.

These dream elements which you are mastering are nothing but elements of your own imagination. And just as you struggle to maintain a mental picture in your head, sometimes we can struggle to keep the lucid dream under our desired control.

A week after I learned to meditate, she let me take back what she once took, and the gaps I'd felt in my memory for a decade were filled. I came to understand myself much better as I processed it all in meditation.

>>33719259 (2/2)
As I mentioned, I'd begun to question my reasoning for being so harsh to her as I realised how much more was possible than I once realised, as long as my perspective is bent a little. Suppose if I'd had a fulfilling spirit relationship, whether with her, or perhaps a dreamy male spirit with many fluffy tails instead. The obvious problem would be me going off the deep end, as I looked down on other humans and felt detached from society. Well, what if it had simply been so fulfilling that there was no malice left in me for me to take out on anyone? Instead, I could make art to express my love even in physical ways.

I don't know if it's just her maddening beauty and strong character, or perhaps my thirst for her abundant energy (as I still refuse to drain as much as I should out of fear of losing myself and harming others), or perhaps some kind of Stockholm syndrome... but lately, I find myself craving her touch. As I find that selfish of me, I find myself thinking I'd like to give her a massage - even a sexual one, if she wanted that. And then I shake my head, thinking I mustn't think things like that. I worry if it's an unwelcome thought, now that I've already decided to marry a human instead; and I could not justify it to my fiancé either.

As I find myself thinking like that, I begin to feel like I hate myself after all again. And then I feel afraid: what if she snaps me out of it like she did before? The last time it happened, I could neither think clearly nor control my emotions. What if I lose sight of what's important to me?

I'm scared... But I don't think that's really her fault. I'm scared of my own feelings.

My negative reaction stemmed mainly from feeling emotionally overwhelmed. Having been ostracised by nearly everyone since I was 5 years old, I wasn't mentally ready for that level of intimacy at all back then, regardless of with whom. Conversely, had she been less intense, I wouldn't have taken an interest.

As conflicted as I felt, and even as I cried within those dreams, even as I was traumatised to an extent, I didn't think of them as nightmares at the time. The sensations, her appearance, the way she took control so that I didn't have to feel guilty for giving in, all of it was sublime beyond what I can put into words. Rather, I felt like there must be something wrong with me for reacting so negatively. And indeed, there were many things wrong with me. To put it into perspective, I first started dating my fiancé when I was 18, but the sexual aspects of my relationship with him didn't become enjoyable for me until I was 23.

But I can hardly believe anything is truly impossible after all I've been through. Had I put my mind to it, I believe I could've overcome those things much sooner with her help. And I believe she could've put my mind to it if she wanted to. But she didn't, and I don't blame her. She genuinely seemed to feel hurt by how I reacted, and sometimes we even argued within those dreams. It saddens me to look back on it: how ungrateful I was, and how I later tried to shift the blame for my own problems onto her. I wonder if I should apologise. I wonder if she wants to apologise too, or if it's arrogant of me to even think that...

Had I accepted her back then, I'd look back and feel like she saved me. And then I'd wonder: what if I had chosen *this* life instead?

Additionally, I learned my new wife was pregnant with my first incubus son. Our house was a huge, open-air bungalow built out of bamboo and palm wood with palm leaves and dry grass as the roof. Some days I would fish from the beach and Selena would sit next to me, both of us in camping chairs. She would bring me food and my favorite drinks. Each island was owned by a high-ranking and close family member of Lilith.

At night, I would hold our infant son after she birthed him whom we named together but I gave him the cover name Ajax. Selena would siphon energy to him to feed him as I held him. When the children were tucked in, Selena and I would sneak off to the beach and cuddle, drinking wine, talking about everything and nothing, having sex, and then sleeping out on the warm sand together under trillions of sparkling stars and soft moonlight from the ever present full moon.

In time, Selena took me and our family to Lilith's palace. I cannot begin to describe it. Gravity is optional in the Astral so it was built in a dizzingly large array of ways that would make no sense on our plane and some of the rooms, particularly Lilith's throne room, were extra-dimensional for security reasons.

There I met the avatar of Lilith. She was so beautiful, radiant, dark, and mysterious and power radiated off her like light radiates from our sun. Her form was ever-shifting with her whims but always a form that was exquisitely, painfully, artfully gorgeous and charming. We went back home through something like a wormhole in the palace and Selena let me stay another three days. Then I said goodbye to my children. Selena left them with a store of food, told them to batten down the house again, as a hurricane strength storm would sometimes hit the island if she was no longer present to protect it. She was teaching our eldest daughter how to protect it while she was gone but the girl had not gotten the hang of it yet. She left Ajax in the care of our middle child. The youngest's responsibility was to watch and learn from her sisters and keep the house clean.

And then, I woke up back in my bed with Selena still curled around me and hugging me tight. What a wild ride. I sometimes felt like Alice in Wonderland but I think I experienced Lilith's heaven. I wanted to share this experience with all of you with Selena's urging and she says you are all welcome to visit one day. If I uncover anymore memories, I will be sure to share them with all of you with Selena's permission.

End

posts.name: Woodie
posts.com:
I practice folkloric sort of witchcraft and believe in Fayerie animism.

Firstly the term itself is fairly new early modern, derived from the Latin term Fatum (Fate), and came in use among celtic nations after Christianization. Hyper-localized ideas and expirences become the bedrock of the folklore, and as they are conceived of as diverse ecologies of invisible beings that live and indwell within an interior of landforms and weather forms. These can include the dead, star beings, house spirits, land wights, old gods and goddesses of the land. They can include beings of all sorts of roles, function, and dispositions. Lots of ghosts are considered Fayeries for example, like Thomas Reid, who supposedly was the familiar spirit of the Cunning woman Bessie dunlop.

I would say they are analogues of Jinn, Daimons, Genii (Genius) etc. In all the aforementioned analogues, hidden people with strange power, who can aid and harm, and are treated with fearful respect, sometimes being in anthropomorphic or therimorphic (and between) are common. the term is used very haphazardly to refer to lots of different things, yeah. Its used as a synonym for "god" at various points, but is at others used to refer to dwarves, both in volundarkvitha where the very dwarf-like protagonist is stated to be an elf, and in voluspa in the list of dwarf names that includes the names "gandalf" (magical staff elf), "vindalf" (wind elf), and just alf (elf).
My pet theory is that, while the term elf is thrown around seemingly at random, there is a definitive group of things in norse mythology that could be called elves: the descendants of Lofar, a large family of dwarves who, it is said, "will be famous as long as the world exists."
This would mean that elves are essentially the germanic equivalent of angels- powerful beings that are servants to the gods.

>>33716143
My uncle saw one of the tiny folk one time.
He never drank or anything like that, was fixing a machine at the factory where he was an engineer and saw a tiny figure peeping out from behind something watching him fix the machine. He said "Come closer if you want to see what I'm doing!" to the little figure and the girl stepped out from behind some packing crates, then quietly watched him fixing the generator for a while then ran back behind the crates. He never saw her again.
I knew him well. He didn't make things up and was the most rational person I know. He said that at the time, it all seemed perfectly normal and it was only afterwards it hit him it was an odd event.
He saw her in the mid 1960s when he had a young family and only told his kids years later.
One thing I've come to realize is that life is never as simple and straightforward nor as mundane as one imagines. There are still mysteries around us.

>>33726022
Stonehenge is a bit touristy.
It's only the one with the biggest stones. There are LOADS of stone circles and other things.
There's a lake that never freezes (somewhere in Cumbria where my granny came from!) and some Welsh lake that people see lights dancing over which some think are 'earthlights' something to do with tectonic plates grinding deep under the Welsh mountains (the 'official explanation') or little flying 'visitors' people saw about town (the 'peoples explanation'); the "Lights of Egryn" is worth a read up about.
Everyone who comes to the UK seems to just go to the same places. Honestly every town here has something. You could spend a lifetime here and only scratch the surface.
Yorkshire has the moorland legends or Lancashire has the woodland legends (because we were never properly conquered by the Romans!) and Wales has the mountain and cave legends.
Stonehenge is nice but they shuffle you away after about five minutes.
You can sleep overnight on the stones of the circles in more out of the way places.
Sorry. Too long post. I love this subject. I'm fascinated by such things. I soak up stories like a sponge.

>>33726160
>Yorkshire
Tons of folklore in Yorkshire. Sacred glades, enchanted forests, bleak and spooky moorland. All the towns are stone houses and tough non-nonsense people... yet the best ghost-stories and some of the wildest legends around. The vikings owned and ran Yorkshire back in the day so tons of norse connections... even in the people's faces!
My granny used to tell my dad about the 'Croak-a-No-Cull'... which I figured out years ago is a reference to the 'Kraken-Knuckr' which is a Norse sea-monster. This makes sense because where she came from the town was once under Danelaw, meaning it was conquered and made an outpost by Viking raiders. That name must have been passed down and tweaked by the telling of the tale from granny to grandkids for a hundred generations.
>It's a bad night out! The 'Croak-a-no-Cal' will get ya...
Kept me by the fire as a kid, I can tell ya!

this
I once got chatting with an old bloke on a bus because some kids knocked his cap off and I picked it up for him and gave it him back. I ended up missing my stop. I noticed his hat had a red-ensign badge/pin on the inside... meaning he was a merchant navy guy.
He was torpedoed in the Mediterranean twice and manned an AA gun on a ship attacked by Italian dive-bombers when troops were going ashore in Sicily. I missed my stop. I never got his name. All because I asked him about the badge in his cap and said my dad was in the RAF. We are often surrounded by heroes and people who make 'celebs' look like nothing.
You don't ask. You don't find out. Their story goes untold. It gets lost in the shifting sands of history... like the lapping of waves erasing footprints on the beach.
Sorry.
Thread about the fae. I get sidetracked.
BTW fae in Cumbria can also mean 'people who have the gift' not just the 'little people'.
The 'gift' being second-sight or something similar... which is always called a 'gift' because the 'little people' were said to bestow it as a gift.
The two are intertwined somehow.

The little ones are more like animals. The large ones (elves) are the Tuatha de Danna (The Children of Dana), a nature goddess. They are all very alien to human understanding. Their concepts of time, space, morals, ethics, fairness are often unfathomable to normal (adult) humans. They are usually repelled by (adult) human thoughts which are like clanging noise to them. Not sure about European style fairies, but in North Georgia I did come across Nunni Hi semi often. They sand a lot, played a lot of music way out in the woods, and there was a raspy voiced old man that would sing pretty often too.

For all intents and purposes they were just, invisible people that were out in the woods. Never once saw a single one of them but I heard them playing music a lot, I found their rock squares out in the woods, and they gathered wild plums in them too. They spoke some weird language and usually got really quiet really fast if anyone walking up made noise or got their attention.

What I did see a whole lot were Will O Wisps every June, they would never ever let anyone get near them and if you wandered towards them they would move back every time. You could sit perfectly still and quiet and they would slowly wander over around you, not noticing you. But if you made a sound they would leave. It's really hard to stay perfectly still and quiet if they are nearby because they are really really bright and one popping off next to your face will always make you jump. They have the same reactions of squirrels or pigeons than any kind of magical creature.

My parents yard had willo-o-wisps every late spring. Like May through June they would show up. The acting like pigeons is accurate, they will flutter all around until the minute you try to walk toward them. They always shrink back from you forever, which I assume is where the stories of them leading people out into the woods to get lost come from. They just retreat from people no matter what. They cannot be fireflies, those don't care if you come near them. They come in three flavors, the baseball sized camera flash little explosions that pop for about a half second and vanish for about 10 seconds. The tiny ones that look almost exactly like christmas tree lights in the exact same colors, and the big slow white ones that are about softball sized that slowly build up brightness then pop off.

It's not innawoods but my mother worked as an ER Nurse for years and she has a lot of stories of a Little Gray Man who would run into the rooms of anyone who was going to die that night.

She described him as a little 1-2 foot tall Uncle Fester or Mini-Me looking guy that was gray skinned and wearing dark gray. She just saw him one night slowly creeping along the room in the ICU floor and then he ran into a room. She went in there and there was no little man. The other nurses said that guy appears when someone is about to die, and the person in that bedroom did die later that night. She saw him a couple more times over the years, always running into a room the same night someone in the room died.

House fairies are a whole different matter. My grandmother described them as having a little homeless drunkard stumbling around in your house from time to time. Breaking things and knocking over stuff all the time.

But one time when my mother sister and I stayed at her house there was apparently a lot of bumping and knocking around on the walls. She would start splashing holy water and it would stop for a while, a while being about 3ish months. Then totally random knocks on the walls, ceiling, behind stuff would slowly start back up again. As if the walls were infested with rats or something thumping around in there and sometimes bumping things in the room, but splashing holy water made it stop.

One time I didn't reup the holy water and wanted to see how weird it got, the bumping at night became almost obnoxious when trying to sleep. It was just constant after a while. Thump on the ceiling, then a knock on a different wall, knock on another wall, bump in the ceiling again. Same kind of noises when a house settles at night only much more constant.

>>33734239
NTA but if we're talking seriously about mental illness now, it absolutely can be a positive to allow the illness to run its course. Almost every longitudinal study that has followed schizophrenics and other people who have experienced psychosis for upwards of 20+ years have found that those who were able to get off and stay off of antipsychotic drugs had profoundly higher rates of functional recovery compared to the people who stayed on the drugs, which, despite immediate or short-term benefit, can result in more frequent relapses and more disability. The schizophrenics who didn't take meds even had better outcomes than the people with just bipolar or other "milder" disorders who stayed on antipsychotics.

Additionally, psychosis has usually been thought of as episodical, and there have been numerous projects and studies that have tried to track (or argue for) the benefit of "letting the psychosis play its course" as a strategy that can result in better outcomes compared to episodes that were crudely halted by the traumatic encounter of hospitalization and medication. And from the beginning of theorizing, going back to Freud's time, psychosis has long been understood as a process that arches towards a definite end that becomes a new normal for the subject, where what we take for visible symptoms are the mind's attempt at its own cure. This is a widespread idea that you can find sources for in the literature if you decide to research. I could cite literature for you to go to, but this is 4chan, and I know you don't really give a shit and want to tell people to take drugs instead.

posts.com:
Gang stalking is simply a form of community mobbing and organized stalking combined. Just like you have workplace mobbing, and online mobbing, which are both fully recognized as legitimate, this is the community form.
Gang stalking is organized harassment at it's best. It the targeting of an individual for revenge, jealousy, sport, or to keep them quite, etc.

It's organized, widespread, and growing. Some describe this form of harassment as, "A psychological attack that can completely destroy a persons life, while leaving little or no evidence to incriminate the perpetrators."

2. Who gets targeted

The people getting targeted seem to be (single) woman, minorities, outspoken individuals, whistle blowers, dissidents, people who have gone against large corporations, etc.

3. Goals of this hate campaign.

The goal is to sensitize the target to a stimuli, isolate the target, make them destitute. The secondary goals seem to be to make the target homeless, jobless, give them a breakdown, and the primary goals seems to be to drive the target to suicide.

4. Who gang stalks.

The surprising thing is that gang stalkers can be found in every level of society. There is no real age barrier, gender barrier, and a variety of races do participate. In almost every occupation in society you can find people who are going along with this.

Gang stalking for many is seen as a game, a sport to be played with another individuals life. Many do not understand or care that the end consequence of this game is to destroy a person.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
5. Why they gang stalk.

"It is conceivable that the participants in the harassment don't even know why the person has been targeted, nor would most of these individuals have any personal stake in harassing the victim.

- Gang stalking is an both an addictive behavior as well as a form of entertainment for the stalkers. There is a vicious kind of pleasure that they derive from bullying their victim. Clearly they like the feeling of being "in control".

Like our society's current obsession with "reality TV", this activity must inevitably gain popularity as the ultimate experience of "reality" entertainment. To the perpetrators, their targets are merely their prey, in a game that never ends. But make no mistake, whatever the reasoning behind it, this is a vicious and calculated hate crime."

-Others are blackmailed or forced into taking part in this activity.

-Others go along with it because they want to fit in and feel part of something that is large and powerful.

-Some are part of community groups who believe they are targeting an undesirable.

-Some are part of the informant groups within cities.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
6. Methods used against targets.

a) Classical conditioning.

Getting a target sensitized to sounds, colors, patterns, actions. Eg. Red, white, yellow, strips, pens clicking, key jangling, coughing, sneezing, whistling, fingers snapping, clapping, etc.

b) 24/7 Surveillance

This will involve following the target everywhere they go. Learning about the target. Where they shop, work, play, who their friends and family are. Getting close to the target, moving into the community or apartment where they live, across the street. Bugging targets phone, house, computer activity.

c) Isolation of target.

This is done via slander campaigns, and lies. Eg. Saying the target is a thief, into drugs, a prostitute, pedophile, crazy, in trouble for something, needs to be watched. False files will even be produced on the target, shown to neighbours, family, store keepers.

d) Noise and mimicking campaigns.

Disrupting the targets life, sleep with loud power tools, construction, stereos, doors slamming, etc. Talking in public about private things in the targets life. Mimicking actions of the target. Basically letting the target know that they are in the targets life. Daily interferences, nothing that would be too overt to the untrained eye, but psychologically degrading and damaging to the target over time.
Visit http://www.gangstalking.ca to see more details.

e) Every day life breaks and street theatre.

Flat tires, putting dirt on targets property. Mass strangers doing things in public to annoy targets. These strangers might get text messaged to be at a specific time and place, and perform a specific action. If might seem harmless to these strangers, but it could be causing great psychological trauma for the target. Eg. Blocking targets path, getting ahead of them in line, cutting or boxing them in on the road, saying or doing things to elicit a response from targets. Etc.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
7. Where can you get help if you are a target?

Use these great links to learn more and to get help.

1. http://www.gangstalking.ca
2. http://catchcanada.org/
3. http://www.rich-essence.com

8. Gang stalking is an illegal form of harassment.

However when targets seek help they still get quite a bit of resistance. Some people in today's society even try to pass gang stalking off as a form of paranoia, even though the meetings in Toronto are held out of the Toronto Rape Crisis Center and many woman's support groups and crisis centers are now aware of gang stalking, and even training their workers to deal with this form of harassment.

In Korea the online version of this is well acknowledged and has even been written about in the International Herald Tribune.
http://www.iht.com/articles/2006/08/14/
news/korea.php

Gang stalking has also been recognized by members of the mobbing community.
http://www.mobbing-usa.com & http://www.gangstalking.ca

The problem with gang stalking just like other urban slang is that it has not been normalized in society, and until it is people will continue to misunderstand this modern day reincarnation of several old time harassment's.

Eg. Gang stalking is similar to what the KKK used against blacks in the south, what Hitlers Brown Shirts used against the Jews, and what the organised harassment the Stasi used against dissidents in East Germany.

It can be hoped that with enough education and understanding this issue will someday become normalized in society and that there will be enough understanding and support for targets.

>>33728020
>I think that every religion big and small has a lot of overlap, it's a pipe dream of mine to travel the world and compare all world religions. I think because they have similar roles in their respective pantheon and are more or less major deities in their pantheon that they could be the same.
I think that's partially true. I've come to understand it that a lot of the entities we interact with when communing with a deity tend to be more like 'titles', for lack of a better terminology, than individuals. Most gods tend to embody fundamental concepts and are woven into an egregor of persona by the observations of man, but that's simply all that we're observing, not necessarily the totality of the the entity we're interacting with. So that's to say, these entities we commune with are made up of 'multiple' deities from various mythologies /pantheons because the inherent nature of what we've collectively deified is a specific facet of them. That said, I suspect there's an affinity you could try and quantify an entity with as 'more Zerus than Ares' or perhaps 'definitively Odin' if an entity primarily (but not entirely) embraces that aspect of themselves. When viewed in this light, it also helps reconcile a lot of the seemingly schizophrenic behavior they exhibit in mythologies because there's more than one entity embodying that aspect in the story and the nature of conflating the deified title with the essence of being tends to lead to the appearance of a somewhat schizophrenic-looking behavior pattern. I also suspect many of them feel very misunderstood by this 'typecasting', but that likely varies on an individual basis. As a disclaimer, this is my current working understanding after a lot of work with a lot of 'gods' but ultimately still filtering through my body's perception so not everything may be perfect.

Young brunette woman with blue eyes. Very happy to be free of the egregorical patchwork she was in for such a long time. Also my soul-wife.

Look, I know the skeptics wont ever take the word of someone else, because discovery is a deeply personal process. Nobody else can perceive for you, but let me share my own experience with ole mandeller.

>The classical statue "The Thinker" gets namedropped as "Something that changed" in a thread just like this one
>Always knew it to be the current iteration, hand under chin, certain of this fact
>Google turns up with some ridiculous pose i've never seen this statue in before, fist to forehead
>I go deep into this phenomenon, finding relics and artifacts of things not being consistent between past and present
>moonraker, "mirror, mirror", "I am your father", the bears, the cornucopia, location of the heart, all stuck out to me as not what I recall, at all. I don't discredit the geography stuff, just didn't know enough to dispute it either way.
>after spending weeks obsessing over what is no longer the same, THE STATUE FLIPS BACK to the current iteration, fist under chin.
>my reality and my past can and have been altered

The one part of these threads that is always sorely missed, is the meaning of the actual content that changed. In my most blatant and personally undeniable example, "the THINKer" invited me to do just that, think.
Each one of these supposed changes all has layers and layers of meaning, but for some reason the internet doesn't want to talk about how "Stein" and "Stain" are two extremely relevant words when placed in context to the past changing.

This is just one piece to what is clearly a puzzle, and most in this thread are guilty of squabbling about individual pieces instead of trying to put them together.

(also, no slidey captcha for this one, dunno if thats good or bad.. but we sending it)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33699402
>This dichotomy seems artificial.
It's not because both types of concentration feel completely different and may indeed be different. "Focusing focus" is akin to unbroken one-pointed focus, whereas "observer focus" is open to the full possibility of experience. posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.com:
I've been meditating for years now and yet I can't really put into words what meditation is, I like the "meditation is deliberate focus of awareness" thing that people usually talk about.

Cultivating the ability to focus takes time. Focusing on the breath or a candle are the 2 basic exercises people recommend, it teaches you to "feel" and "observe" which are different from "thinking", it may take months to snap out of the "thinking" mode for just a second but that sole second is enough to show you that your thinking mind is not you nor your reality, it's like a radio which plays all the time and you were living with that radio open for most of your life.

>>33699233
For me the "observer" focus/mode is when you are not a slave to your thoughts and you are calmer thus you don't get dragged away by them, while the "focus" focus is the ability to focus on one thing with all your might, I say that those 2 go hand-in-hand and maybe someone could say that they are the same thing: the ability to take a step back from everything, be calm and direct your focus/observing whatever you want.

Also during my sits I remember how to feel my feelings. Feelings inhabit your body and you can feel them better if you focus on them, they usually carry forgotten memories or various insights and blissful states if you focus on them enough.

Meditation is a paradox to me, it's like a means to an end but also the end itself, it's like a vehicle which takes you places but also it's just erasing all the unnecessary noise around you to realize that all those places were always here next to you.

So sit and watch your breath, feel your body breathing, your mind will make thousands of stories about anything but just let it be, don't even label those thoughts, don't even say "I'm letting them go", just let them be and focus on your breath, on the feeling of your body breathing, your mind will say "that's stupid, analyzing these important things is better", but just focus on the breath.

>>33710828
What you say makes sense but from my own experiences I 'd say that those 2 are the same thing.

Focusing is like an ability, people are good at it or not.

You can be focused on just this moment and your surroundings without being focused on a single object. This is like being totally present, you are focused on the present, your mind isn't wandering outside of your control, thoughts may pop up but they don't take you away in daydreaming (which most people have but don't realize). Imagine that this focusing ability is like a magnifying glass, let's say that what I just described is the point "zero" of the magnifying glass, our basic reality. This is what you called the "observer" mode.

However you can zoom into one single thing using that magnifying glass, say your breath or an object. You can literally move your entire consciousness towards that thing to the point that your awareness travels there, some people say that "wizards/shamans/yogis" can move their entire consciousness towards that object and move it with their will or inhabit the body of an animal, others say that they can zoom their eyesight so much to the point that they look at the atoms of an object, some even say that they hypnotize others through this way. This is the point "1" of the glass.

Conversely you can even zoom out, you can become the whole room and even look at yourself from above, you can become your whole house and the whole city, you can focus on the whole galaxy and the whole cosmos, you can even break the linear time illusion and realize that everything is one single moment which takes place here and now. Let's say that this is the point "-1" of the glass.

That's what meditation is: Realizing that you are everything at the same time, your awareness can go everywhere since you are part of the whole, the ego is an illusion, break free from it and realize that you are whole, ignore your thoughts which most of the time are just the ego talking nonsense.

>>33699233
This post made me want to share something semi-related - an experience of mine:

For years I always wondered if non-directive meditation is the same as directive meditation, or if one was better than the other or even the "correct way to meditate".

In the non-directive kind you just sit and be aware, if something pops up you just watch it until it goes away without making stories in your mind about it.

In the directive aka focus meditation you focus on a single object and you stay with it, if something else pops up you immediately return to the object.

After practicing both for a long time I can say one thing: They both have the same result which is your thinking mind eventually quieting down, the thoughts become less and less and you are left in silence and that's when the real fun begins.

(continued in the next post)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33726002
(cont.)

I could say that non-directive would be better suited for advanced practitioners who can manage their thoughts better and are better at not being dragged away from their wandering mind, those are the practitioners who are more grounded, whose their breath is 24/7 calm. That's the "observer focus" you are talking about.

Directive is better for people who are new to meditation, those people are usually overthinkers, their breath patterns are all over the place, I'd suggest that someone who begins meditation focuses on his belly expanding or his chest or on the feeling the air makes in his throat. I suggest this because in an overthinking beginner the thoughts are coming at a very fast and strong rate. Imagine this kind of meditation like you holding on a steel pole with all your might so the tornado (thoughts) won't drag you away. That's the "focusing focus" you talked about.

So it all comes down to having a calm mind, and sitting will do this anyway, sit in the dark with no sound or anything to bother you and the thoughts WILL stop, what really helps is if you also incorporate breathwork and physical exercise in your everyday life and if you reduce screen usage (which fills your mind with lots of information), these will help you reach the "no-thought" state faster.

I remember sitting down to do "Focus on breath" meditation and various memories and bad feelings popped up, I ignored them and returned to the breath, then thoughts like "You are ignoring what's important!" popped up and I became anxious that I was using meditation to run away from my problems but I knew that I wasn't really doing that and that was just my overthinking mind not wanting to stop. Most of our problems are just thoughts in our minds and are not real at all.

So just sit and focus on the breath or on the moment, or on your body, don't think too much about it, thoughts and words are not everything, feeling is also important, feeling this moment here now.

>>33700019
Start with objects that are in another room from where you are. Then move on to physical settings in the house, imagine whole rooms and whole layouts of the house. Next, move to things that are outdoors like a park, a lake, forest or other natural settings of the sort. After that move to more dynamic situations like a busy city center, a school campus between classes when there's a lot of people walking everywhere, a busy restaurant, etc. After than imagine scenarios with yourself and other people who are immediately with you where you give each person unique physical attributes, personality traits and have them say the certain things you want them to say.

Literally that simple. Should take you sometime.

posts.com:
>>33732995
Shut off your PC monitor, close your laptop, back away from the desk.

Sit up right but remain in a relaxed position. Close your eyes. Take a deep breath through your nose and feel as the air travels down through your lungs and you expand your belly to fullness. Holy for 3 seconds, then slowly exhale through your pursed lips. Repeat twice more. Feel relaxed and just let your thoughts flow. Don't get in their way, just let them happen, sit back and observe. Keep breathing normally through your nose and continue to let your thoughts happen, sit back and observe them. Do this for the next 5 minutes.

There. You've done mindfulness meditation and you are going to feel better after the 5 minutes are up. Do this for the next few weeks and write down any worries, anxieties, intrusive thoughts, or recurring themes that run through your mind while meditating.

That's literally all you have to know right now. Meditation is one of those things that are better of just experiencing from the get got instead of reading about them. You can do body scan meditations, mantra meditations, visualization meditation and KUNDALINI BRO later. No need to complicate things.

Keep reading and lurking the thread for resources.

Leporidae, according to Wikipedia, is the family of mammals that include both Hares and rabbits. While they both are distinct classifications some hares are falsely considered rabbits and other way around but this is just a little silly introduction and it's not important.

What is the subject of this thread is a symbolism of Leporidae which goes beyond association with a good luck and fertility. Do they have any occult symbolism since they are sometimes sacrificed in rituals and seem to appear in paranormal media;

><><><><><><><><><
The book "Alice's Adventure in Wonderland" from 1856 presents us with a probably first mentioning of a term "Down the rabbit hole" which since then became popular and gained different meaning that all connect to finding oneself or falling in a hard to get out extraordinary situation.
>
The Movie "Donnie Darko" from 2001 features a man dressed up in a scary bunny suit, named Frank, with a role of a Manipulated Dead which is scaring and leading the Protagonist during the movie. The Manipulated Dead are real characters that are supposed to die in a Tangent Universe and have a role of setting an Ensurance trap for Protagonist to ensure that he saves the Main Timeline by sending The Artifact to the Main Universe through the portal or The Wormhole, which goes back to Rabbit's hole metaphor.

posts.com:
SOLAR COLORS
>The theory so long held of three primary and four secondary colors is purely exoteric, for since the earliest periods it has been known that there are seven, and not three, primary colors, the human eye being capable of estimating only three of them. Thus, although green can be made by combining blue and yellow, there is also a true or primary green which is not a compound. This can he proved by breaking up the spectrum with a prism. Helmholtz found that the so-called secondary colors of the spectrum could not be broken up into their supposed primary colors. Thus the orange of the spectrum, if passed through a second prism, does not break up into red and yellow but remains orange.

>Consciousness, intelligence, and force are fittingly symbolized by the colors blue, yellow, and red. The therapeutic effects of the colors, moreover, are in harmony with this concept, for blue is a fine, soothing, electrical color; yellow, a vitalizing and refining color; and red, an agitating and heat-giving color. It has also been demonstrated that minerals and plants affect the human constitution according to their colors. Thus a yellow flower generally yields a medicine that affects the constitution in a manner similar to yellow light or the musical tone mi. An orange flower will influence in a manner similar to orange light and, being one of the so-called secondary colors, corresponds either to the tone re or to the chord of do and mi.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33737288
The ancients conceived the spirit of man to correspond with the color blue, the mind with yellow, and the body with red. Heaven is therefore blue, earth yellow, and hell--or the underworld--red. The fiery condition of the inferno merely symbolizes the nature of the sphere or plane of force of which it is composed. In the Greek Mysteries the irrational sphere was always considered as red, for it represented that condition in which the consciousness is enslaved by the lusts and passions of the lower nature. In India certain of the gods--usually attributes of Vishnu--are depicted with blue skin to signify their divine and supermundane constitution. According to esoteric philosophy, blue is the true and sacred color of the sun. The apparent orange-yellow shade of this orb is the result of its rays being immersed in the substances of the illusionary world.

In the original symbolism of the Christian Church, colors were of first importance and their use was regulated according to carefully prepared rules. Since the Middle Ages, however, the carelessness with which colors have been employed has resulted in the loss of their deeper emblematic meanings. In its primary aspect, white or silver signified life, purity, innocence, joy, and light; red, the suffering and death of Christ and His saints, and also divine love, blood, and warfare or suffering; blue, the heavenly sphere and the states of godliness and contemplation; yellow or gold, glory, fruitfulness, and goodness; green, fecundity, youthfulness, and prosperity; violet, humility, deep affection, and sorrow; black, death, destruction, and humiliation. In early church art the colors of robes and ornaments also revealed whether a saint had been martyred, as well as the character of the work that he had done to deserve canonization.
https://www.sacred-texts.com/eso/sta/sta11.htm
